text: An acute angle ("acute" meaning "small") is an angle smaller than a right angle. The range of an acute angle is between 0 and 90 degrees, or between 0 and \frac{\pi}{2} radians. Angles larger than a right angle (90 degrees) are called obtuse. They are found exclusively in Quadrant I or a graph, due to the terminal arm not being able to leave this Quadrant without becoming too large. ==Related == * Obtuse angle * Right angle Category:Angles
title: Acute angle
